issue.title: [C++] Use glog (or some other tool) to print stack traces in debug builds on errors
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-614](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-614). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
When an error Status is returned in a test case, we do not have a full stack trace of where the error occurred. I believe that glog provides this functionality on x86/x86_64

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-614?focusedCommentId=16190710) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I moved this off, as this is mostly resolved with `-DARROW_EXTRA_ERROR_CONTEXT`

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-614?focusedCommentId=16682595) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
With -DARROW_EXTRA_ERROR_CONTEXT=ON and glog backtraces for other crashes, I think we have enough logging for now
